buddy_profile.name: Delphine Laurien
buddy_profile.title: ASEAN & MENA Head of Procurement & Supply Chain - Aden Services
buddy_profile.introduction: I hold a master's degree in Strategic Procurement (DESMA) and have nearly 20 years of experience in procurement and supply chain transformation within the services industry (Facility Management, Food, Textiles, Hospitality, and remote sites). My career spans across Europe, Asia, and currently the Middle East. I am passionate about transformation and change management, with expertise in strategic procurement, process standardization, and supply chain digitalization.
qualifications: Certified Sustainable Supply Chain Professional (CSSCP) - ISCEA accredited (2022)
buddy_profile.experience: Nearly 20 years in procurement and supply chain transformation
expertise_focus: Process standardization to achieve organizational goals
Supply chain digitalization for long-term success
top_3_advice: Stay informed: A strong network keeps individuals and organizations up to date on the latest industry developments, regulatory changes, and emerging trends in sustainability.
Track and measure your actions: Keep in mind that what gets measured can be effectively managed.
Achieve more with less: Don't assume sustainable solutions will lead to extra costs. The primary goal is to reduce the total cost of ownership and gain a competitive edge.
buddy_profile.how_to_help: I'd be glad to share my experience on defining and implementing a sustainable procurement strategy, as well as how to effectively communicate with stakeholders to gain their support.

sustainability_journey.origin: Began career at leading European professional laundry services company with naturally sustainable business model
sustainability_journey.business_model: Rental-based services maximizing product use, promoting recycling, balancing economic growth with environmental impact
sustainability_journey.sourcing_experience: Actively sourced textiles from Asia and Africa (Pakistan, India, China, Ethiopia, Egypt, Syria)
sustainability_journey.awakening_moment: Rana Plaza collapse in 2013 heightened awareness of ESG challenges and need for supplier collaboration
sustainability_journey.certification: Joined CSSCP program in 2022 to enhance sustainable supply chain practices
sustainability_journey.tmi_involvement: Friend recommended The Matcha Initiative - contributing to help businesses develop sustainable supply chain solutions

implemented_sustainable_actions.details: Developed textile products from organic cotton with Fairtrade certification, improving wages, working conditions, and fair trade terms with small cotton producers
Implemented RFID technology to extend textile lifecycle and optimize inventory use, resulting in waste reduction and increased resource efficiency
Helped establish Corporate Social Responsibility policy for procurement process, created supplier code of conduct, defined framework for supplier CSR assessments
Supporting local communities through responsible sourcing in Pakistan and APAC region, strengthening employment and income opportunities to alleviate poverty

challenges_and_solutions.challenge: Organizations may not prioritize sustainability due to short-term focus, cost concerns, lack of awareness, or limited leadership commitment
challenges_and_solutions.personal_approach: Continue self-learning and expanding network for access to resources, expertise, and industry connections
challenges_and_solutions.strategy: Start with small, gradual steps, understanding change management takes time

sustainable_supply_chain_skills: Strategic thinking: Align procurement with overall sustainability goals
Change management: Lead teams through transitions to meet sustainability goals
Innovation: Embrace new technologies promoting sustainability
Collaboration: Work effectively with cross-functional teams and external partners
buddy_profile.proudest_achievement: Working with team on sustainable project to replace single-use products with fully circular solution. In addition to significantly reducing waste and CO2 emissions, this project provides opportunity to educate and raise awareness among many end users in remote areas of Asia Pacific region where sustainability is not yet part of everyday life.
buddy_profile.procurement_philosophy: The future of procurement will be based on sustainability. As procurement leaders, our responsibility is to present solid business case based on '3 P's' framework—People, Planet, and Profit—offering solutions beneficial for business, cost-effective, and positive for planet and people.
solution_codes: 06.02 - Sustainable Supply Chain Eco Design & Circularity
